sentence.Network_en: Constant wheelchair use will scuff almost any floor surface.
sentence.Network_cn: 任何地板上经常有轮椅走动几乎都会有所磨损。

sentence.Network_en: He is now quadriplegic and confined to a wheelchair.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在的他四肢麻痹，只能呆在轮椅上。

sentence.Network_en: The person can transfer from wheelchair to seat with relative ease.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个人可以比较轻松地从轮椅上移到座位上。

entry.def: A wheelchair is a chair with wheels that you use in order to move about in if you cannot walk properly, for example because you are disabled or sick.

means.word_mean: 1. a movable chair mounted on large wheels; for invalids or those who cannot walk; frequently propelled by the occupant

auth_sentence.content: Wheelchair racer David Weir gets an MBE, too.

auth_sentence.content: He sits in a wheelchair, his face lowered.

auth_sentence.content: I have to go everywhere in my electric wheelchair.

sentences.en: She has been able to cast aside (= stop using) her wheelchair.
The building has been specially designed to provide easy access for people in wheelchairs.
sentences.cn: 这幢房子特地设计得便于坐轮椅的残疾人进出。
